Tears of joy streamed down Hannah's face.

"Oh ,thank you! Thank you! Thank you!" Hannah cheered. She leaned in and gave Simon a big hug and a soft warm kiss on the lips.
"I love you, brave Simon." She whispered.

Abruptly, as if to ruin their special moment, Hannah's tummy let out a loud rumble. She hadn't eaten anything since morning and I was already getting late.
"Wha... What was that?" Simon asked.
"My tummy." Hannah said, a little sad.
"Aw, are you hungry?" Simon said.
"Uh huh. I haven't eaten since breakfast." Hannah said.
"I'll go back and talk to the Duke. Maybe I can grab some table scraps for you." Simon said.

Simon went back to the dinner table where Duke Dumblock and his nobleman friends were just finishing up. Simon sat down and slipped a little bit of pork and some bread in his pocket. He waited for a chance to speak up. Finally, after the Duke got done telling a long and pointless story about a bridge, Simon spoke.
"So, Your Highness, I was out in the toilets when I met your cute slave girl." Simon said.
"Ah, that's Hannah. Hard worker, she is. Just get distracted easy is all. Nothing a little bop on the head with my old scepter doesn't fix. Ha ha!" Duke Dumblock said.
"Is she for sale?" Simon asked.
"Oh, the boy's lookin' for a companion on his journey, huh? Hm... Maybe. How much you got?" Duke Dumblock said.
Simon looked into his sack of coins.
"Ten gold, and fifteen silver." Simon said.
"Ah, that's not enough for her. The girl shows a lot of promise in slavery. It'll cost you more than that." Duke Dumblock said.
"Isn't there some other way?" Simon said.

Duke Dumblock thought about it for a moment. He had guests to entertain and nothing to do for the rest of the week He thought it over.
"All right, boy, you can have her for free... if you can beat me in a friendly joust tomorrow! If you win, you get the slave girl. If I win, I get you money AND your pretty white horse! Haw haw haw!" Duke Dumblock said. He was always a sporting man, so a game or challenge seemed the best way to go. He was a decent jouster; he had been riding since he was a lad. What he didn't know was that Simon had grown up in a horse town, and was already an expert rider at the age of twelve.
"Challenge accepted, Your Highness!" Simon said, excitedly he stood up to leave now that everyone was done eating.
"Ah, good competitive spirit, boy! see you on the field tomorrow! Good night." Duke Dumblock said.

Simon made his way back to the toilets, but Hannah wasn't there. He went down to the slave quarters, and what he found shocked him. Hannah was being manhandled by a big burly overseer. The rough man was pushing her around, trying to bed her over his knee for a spanking.
"Quit struggling, runt!" The overseer said. He pulled off Hannah's potato sack, leaving her completely naked. He pushed the scared, crying girl over his knee and gave her a strong whack on her bare butt. He was about to deliver another whack hen Simon ran over.

"Hey, what's going on here?" Simon said, outraged.

"Well, stop. I'm the reason she didn't finish." Simon said. He felt really bad knowing that distracting her had caused her to get punished.
"You are, are you?" The overseer said.
"Yeah, I am. I got into a long conversation with her earlier. I take full responsibility." Simon said.
The overseer looked at Simon, then looked a the cleaning brush. Then he looked at the scared naked little girl in his hands.
"Well, if it's your responsibility, I don't supposed you could finish the job for her, could you?" The overseer said.
"Not a problem. Just let her go." Simon said.
"Fine." The overseer said. He released Hannah, who ran over to Simon and cowered in his arms. He stroked her dirty hair to comfort her.
"Hey, it's okay. It's oaky." Simon whispered in her ear. He slipped her the pieces of pork and bread from his pocket as he embraced her.

Hannah slipped on her potato sack dress and quickly ate the table scraps before any of the other slaves could see it and try to mooch off of her. It was the best food she had eaten in a long time.

11521.content:
Hannah was informed the next day that Simon was to joust with Duke Dumblock in order to win her freedom. Most of the castle thought it was a joke for a young boy to accept a challenge from Duke Dumblock, a grown and experienced man, and came expecting Simon to lose handily. They wanted to laugh as their beloved Lord won a battle.

Hannah was permitted to take a break from washing the heaps of dirty laundry that morning to watch the spectacle. She saw Duke Dumblock in his finest silver armor atop his highblooded silver steed, Mercury. The trumpeters thundered their praise for the glorious duke. Next the challenger, young Simon rode onto the field. He wore a tough iron breastplate over a red tunic, and a small iron helmet so you could see his face. Most of the crowd thought that he would lose, but cheered him on anyway as a show of good sportsmanship.

The two of them rode to opposite sides of the field where each was given a brightly colored wooden lance. Duke Dumblock was given a regal purple and gold colored lance, while Simon was given a slimmer red and blue lance made for squires. One of the castle's priest came in to act as the referee. He held up a flag with the Dumblock crest on it.
"All right, on your mark... Charge!" The priest yelled, waving the flag.
The whole crowd's heart were racing as the two riders galloped toward one another. In an instant, both of their lances connected and both riders winced in pain. Hannah couldn't help but flinch and let out a small yelp just seeing it. The lances were broken on their tough armors, but both riders held firm. Neither had fallen. The two of them rode back to their original starting positions to receive another lance. The crowd was growing nervous. Not many jousters lasted more than one round against their duke. The priest raises the flag again.
"On your mark... Charge!" He called out, waving the flag.

Simon now knew how to beat Duke Dumblock. The Duke rode in fast and reckless to put more power behind his lance thrust. Just before making contact, Simon leaned to the side just a tiny bit to avoid Duke Dumblock's Lance. His opponent was going so fast, he had no time to react, and missed his target entirely. Simon took this opportunity to smash his lance into Duke Dumblock's shoulder, pushing the man off of his horse, tumbling to the ground. The crowd was shocked to see their duke defeated by a child. Everything fell silent for a moment until the priest came over with his flag. He raised it and called out,
"The winner is the boy adventurer, Simon!"
Everyone cheered for him, despite the fact that he had just made fool out of their ruler, seeing as he had lost to a young boy. Simon dismounted his horse, Lightning, and met Duke Dumblock to help him to his feet. The Duke nodded to him.
"You're a very good jouster, boy. You won fair and square. Now take your slave girl and go." He said, a little sour about losing in front of everyone.

Simon ran over to Hannah, and pulled her onto his white horse. They rode off into the distance like it was some kind of dream come true. It was the happiest moment of Hannah's life. She clung to his back, her hero. They rode fast across the plains, trying to put as much distance between Castle Dumblock and themselves as possible. Hannah had had enough of that awful place and wanted to leave her old life behind. Eventually, they reached a clear stream in the middle of the plains. Simon stopped his horse and got off, tying Lightning to a nearby tree.
"This is a good place to stop. I can refill my canteens and you can take a bath." Simon said, getting a couple of canteens out from his saddlebags.
Hannah was still very dirty from cleaning everything yesterday. She rarely had time to take baths.
"Okay." She said, pulling off the potato sack she used as a dress. She had no real problem with being naked around Simon. She had already cowered naked in his arms after he saved her from the overseer's spanking, not that she had any real problem with nudity anyway. Hannah often had to work in very little or no clothing while cleaning chimneys and sweeping streets on extremely hot days. She ran into the water with no hesitation.

The clean water rushing against her skin felt amazing. Hannah dunked her head underwater and scrubbed her messy hair. It felt so good to have all that itchy dirt washing off. Simon looked t the filthy potato sack on the ground, and then to Hannah in the water.
"I'll have to get you some nicer clothes eventually too. I can't have you running around in a potato sack like a beggar." Simon said.
Hannah smiled back at him. He sat down at the water's edge.

Simon and Hannah went down to the pub.
"What are we going to the pub for?" Hannah asked.
"Don't you know? Pubs are where all the action is! We're on an adventure, and if you want to know where the adventuring's at, you go to the pub." Simon said.
He grabbed Hannah by the wrist and pulled her inside. The scent of whiskey and tobacco was strong in the small, poorly lit building, but the men and women inside seemed to be having a fun time.
"You ever tried mead before?" Simon said.
"No." Hannah said, shaking her head.
"Well, you should try it out! You might like it." Simon said.
He took Hannah over to the bar and the two of them sat on the tall stools. The barkeep looked at them like they were a little young to be in a drinking establishment, but decided not to give them shit about it.
"One small mead that we can share, please." Simon said.
"All drink are a silver coin." The barkeep said, filling up small glass.
"Not a problem." Simon said. He took a coin from his bag and set it don on the bar.

Hannah looked at the alcoholic beverage with wonder.
"What is it?" She asked.
"Fermented honey, the good stuff." The barkeep said. His homemade mead was his pride and joy.
Hannah took a sip. It tasted sweet and bitter, both at once, with a strong aftertaste. She felt like her head was swimming.
"Ooh, I like it." Hannah said.
Simon took a sip too.
"Wow! This stuff packs a wallop! That's some good ale, sir." He said to the barkeep. For being so young, Simon had already had his share of ale. It came with the territory of being an adventurer. The barkeep smiled.
"You guys know some good ale when you try it, then. This is the best stuff in town, and one of my best batches." The barkeep said.

Simon and Hannah took turns sipping their drink.
"So, what's a couple of kids like you doing out here, anyway?" He said.
"We're adventuring. I'm looking for vengeance on the dragon that killed my village. I saved her from slavery yesterday." Simon said, pointing to Hannah.
"Hannah took a long drink from the mead.
"We're in love!" She loudly said, smiling.
"Aw, that's cute. So, I suppose you're looking for treasure or whatever, huh? That's what adventurers do, right?" The barkeep said.
"Yeah!" Simon said. He finished off the glass of mead. He felt a little buzzed now, like he could take on anything.
"Well, we've been avoiding the north bridge. A ghoul's been lurking down there lately. Nearly attacked my buddy Ron the other day, but he chilled the hell out and backed away before it noticed." The barkeep said.
"Oh, we are all over that!" Simon said.
He grabbed Hannah by the wrist and pulled her outside. Quickly, he rode Lightning the horse north toward a bridge over a deep ravine. He drew his shortsword.

"Simon, I've never fought monsters before! What do I do?" Hannah said.
Simon dug through his pack and pulled out a dagger. He handed it to Hannah.
"Leave it to me! If the ghoul gets close, just yell out and stab it with this. I'll handle this, though. Ghouls are nothing I haven't taken care of before." Simon said.
"What're ghouls like?" Hannah asked.
"Evil dead bodies, basically. They'll try and drain your life, but they're slow and dumb." Simon said.
"But how do you kill them if they're already dead?" Hannah asked.
"Stab 'em." Simon said, nonchalantly.

Simon and Hannah slowly made their way down the ravine. They heard an inhuman moaning in the distance.
"That's the ghoul. We must be close." Simon said.
They edged their way to the bottom and saw the ghoul. It appeared to have once been a young woman, but it had a broken lance skewered through her heart. She stood over a battered treasure chest.
"Score! We might get some loot today!" Simon said excitedly.

Simon rushed into battle and swung his sword at the ghoul woman. With a single slice, he severed the monster's arm. Hannah gasped in shock. The ghoul, unable to feel pain, slowly turned to face Simon.
"You want more?" Simon taunted.
He swung his blade at the ghoul again, but it only glanced off of her torso. The ghoul gave Simon a powerful whack on the face. Stunned, Simon fell back a couple steps. Hannah shrieked in fright, seeing her boyfriend attacked like that. The ghoul pounced on Simon now, giving him a strong body slam. He fell beneath her, struggling to get back up.
"Ah! Crud! Get off of me!" Simon shouted.
He struggled to get his sword ready to try and cut the ghoul apart before she could drain his life force, but heard a scream. The sound of metal cutting into flesh resounded throughout the ravine. Soon, the ghoul fell limp. Hannah stood on the other side with her knife in her hand, stained with ghoul ichor. She was panting. Simon stood up.
"Great save, Hannah! You'll be just as good an adventurer as I ma in no time!" He said, giving her a big hug.
Hannah was still panting.
"I just saw you about to get hurt and I panicked, I..." She stammered.
"You did great!" Simon said. He sheathed his sword.
"Now let's see what kind of treasure she was guarding." He said, kicking the ghoul's body aside.

Simon opened up the treasure chest. The first thing he found was a dusty short dress with a couple of cheap brooches to hold it together. It was short enough to try and look sexy on an adult, but for a kid it would be the perfect length.
"Oh, an extra change of clothes. Do you think this will fit you?" He asked Hannah.
Hannah threw off her potato sack and put on the ghoul's dress. It was a little loose on her, but it fit.
"Oh, it's great! thank you!" Hannah said.
Simon dug through the chest some more. There was a little bit of garbage in there, a broken chicken bone, some string...
"Aw, this is mostly garbage." Simon said.
He dug through some more until he found a lady's purse, probably belonging to the ghoul from back when she was a human. Simon opened it up.
"Nice, a gold coin and three silver. That's decent." He said.

"I never asked you, but Hannah... Do you want to learn how to fight so you can help me in my quest?"

If you do want to learn, I'll teach you everything I know... and if afterward, you want to go out on own, you can... whatever you want to do, it is for now on your choice."

Hannah took a moment to think about her answer. After a few seconds of silence, she responded, a sliver of determination lining her voice. "I want to be of use to you Simon. I want to be able to help you when you need me. If that means I have to fight by your side, then I want to be ready. I want to always be by your side!"

For a moment, Simon had to turn his head toward Hannah, surprised at the conviction in her voice. He couldn't help but smile at her, happy to have a companion as dedicated and loyal as Hannah for his quest. He turned his head forward, and responded with, "Alright then."
